channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Middle Eastern funds are plowing billions of dollars into hottest AI start-ups
item.description: Oil-rich nations are turning from oil to artificial intelligence to diversify their economies.

item.title: Intel's wild week leaves Wall Street more uncertain than ever about chipmaker's future
item.description: Intel still makes the majority of processors at the heart of PCs, laptops, and servers, but that's not enough to appease investors.

item.title: Why EU tariffs are unlikely to dent Chinese EV makers' European expansion
item.description: To make the European market unattractive for Chinese EV exports, tariffs have to be as high as 50%, according to research group Rhodium.

item.title: House Speaker Johnson axes Trump voting restrictions in new government funding bill
item.description: Congressional Democrats and Republicans have eight days to strike a funding deal before the government goes into a partial shutdown.

item.title: These are the 3 patterns of the ‘chronically single,’ says breakup expert
item.description: Amy Chan, 42, is the author of "Breakup Bootcamp: The Science of Rewiring Your Heart." She brought in over $200,000 in 2023 with her business.

item.title: Britain's ultra-wealthy are threatening to exit en masse ahead of proposed tax changes
item.description: Labour's plans to axe the U.K.'s non-dom tax regime could spark an ultra wealthy exodus, advisers and research bodies have warned.

item.title: Qualcomm recently approached Intel about a possible takeover
item.description: If Qualcomm were to acquire Intel, it would be one of the largest technology deals on record, but would first invite hefty regulatory scrutiny.

item.title: Harris raised 4 times more than Trump in donations for final election sprint
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris also raised $47 million in the 24 hours after the debate against Donald Trump.

item.title: Indian ed-tech startup Physics Wallah bags $2.8 billion valuation amid sector troubles
item.description: Physics Wallah CEO Alakh Pandey said the company would use the $210 million funding to expand its business and do acquisitions.

item.title: American Airlines in talks to pick Citigroup over rival bank Barclays for crucial credit card deal, sources say
item.description: American has been working with banks and card networks on a new deal with the aim of consolidating its business with a single issuer, sources tell CNBC.

item.title: Trump Media closes at a new 52-week low on heavy trading after lockup expires
item.description: Former President Donald Trump's majority stake in the Truth Social owner was worth $1.5 billion by Friday's close.

item.title: Apple iPhone 16, Apple Watch Series 10 and AirPods 4 debut around the world
item.description: Apple greeted customers at its stores around the world on Friday, for the debuts of the iPhone 16, Apple Watch Series 10 and AirPods 4.

item.title: Fed Governor Waller says inflation softening faster than he expected put him in half-point-cut camp
item.description: Waller told CNBC that the data is showing core inflation in the Fed's preferred measure is running below 1.8%

item.title: UAE hoping to expand $1 trillion partnership with U.S. through AI, Investment
item.description: The visit is also expected to feature meetings with key U.S. business leaders and tech executives.

item.title: In U.S. trade war with China, Mexico is emerging as the big winner
item.description: A CNBC analysis of trade data reveals a multi-year surge in trade between China and Mexico helping manufacturers and the supply chain avoid Trump/Biden tariffs.

item.title: Europe automaker shares slump after Mercedes becomes latest to cut 2024 guidance
item.description: Mercedes shares fell more than 6% Friday after the German carmaker cut its 2024 guidance on the back of weaker demand from China.

item.title: Huawei's trifold phone is proving popular among Apple iPhone fans in Beijing
item.description: Out of 10 people CNBC talked to, eight said they are interested in both the new Huawei and Apple phones.

item.title: China unexpectedly leaves benchmark lending rates unchanged after Fed’s jumbo cut
item.description: The People's Bank of China (PBOC) said it would keep the one-year loan prime rate (LPR) at 3.35%, as well as the five-year LPR at 3.85%.

item.title: Constellation Energy to restart Three Mile Island nuclear plant, sell the power to Microsoft for AI
item.description: Constellation described the agreement with Microsoft as the largest power purchase agreement that the nuclear plant operator has ever signed.

item.title: Nike CEO John Donahoe is out, replaced by company veteran Elliott Hill
item.description: Nike CEO John Donahoe will retire from the company in October. He will be succeeded by company veteran Elliott Hill.

item.title: Bank of Japan keeps key interest rate steady as it treads cautiously on normalizing policy
item.description: The decision came as the central bank seeks to wean its economy off the long-held ultra-easy monetary policy and curb the yen's slide against the U.S. dollar.

item.title: Companies face risk of huge fines and suspensions under tough new cyber rules in the EU
item.description: Companies could face hefty fines or even suspensions of service in the EU under strict new cybersecurity regulations set to come into force next month.

item.title: The Fed has set out on a 'recalibration' of policy. Here's what Powell's new buzzword means
item.description: Asset prices soared as investors took Powell at his word that the outsized rate cut wasn't in response to a substantial economic weakening.

item.title: Anthony Scaramucci says he is 'working alongside' Kamala Harris on her campaign's crypto policies
item.description: "I believe that we are making progress, and I think it's going in the right direction," Scaramucci said at the annual TOKEN2049 event in Singapore.

item.title: Ray Dalio says the Fed has a tough balancing act as the economy faces 'enormous amount of debt'
item.description: On Wednesday, Dalio listed debt, money and the economic cycle as one of the top five forces influencing the global economy.

item.title: 'Very serious escalation': Lebanese ministers warn of a dangerous next 48 hours after pager and device attacks
item.description: The next 48 hours, Lebanon's health and economy ministers told CNBC, will be particularly dangerous.

item.title: Tesla’s Chinese rival Nio cuts price for new Onvo-branded car
item.description: There's yet another Chinese electric car aiming to undercut Tesla, with a steeper discount.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Will India's lofty manufacturing ambitions bear fruit?
item.description: As the 10th anniversary of the Make in India initiative nears, CNBC's Inside India takes a look at how the nation's manufacturing has evolved — and what more needs to be done.

item.title: Tesla, Nvidia lead tech-heavy Nasdaq to one of best days of 2024 after Fed rate cut
item.description: Following the Federal Reserve's interest rate cut, tech stocks had a slightly delayed rally but jumped on Thursday, with the Nasdaq climbing 2.5%.

item.title: Elon Musk's X and Starlink face nearly $1 million in daily fines for alleged ban evasion in Brazil
item.description: X and Starlink face daily fines of $5 million reals (about $920,000) for alleged ban evasion maneuvers by X in Brazil.
